page.title: 18ENTERTAINMENT AT TEVIOTHEAD
page.content: THE HALL AT TEVOITHEAD IS THE VENUE FOR VARIOUS ACTIVITIES{.'OLDE TYME'} {DANCES}SUCH AS,STRIP THE WILLOW; EIGHTSOME REEL;HIGHLAND SCOTTISHE AND OTHERS ARE DANCED TO MUSIC BY FIDDLE, ACCORDION AND ELECTRONIC ORGAN FOR BACK-UP.PERSONS YOUNG AND OLD ATTEND.THERE ARE{DISCO DANCES}WHEN POPULAR RECORDS AND TUNES ARE PLAYED,BEING LOUDLY AMPLIFIED THROUGH SPEAKERS.THE'DISC JOCKEY'PLAYING THE RECORDS PUTS UP COLOURED LIGHTS IN THE HALL WHICH FLASH ON AND OFF ALL EVENING.THE YOUNGER GENERATION ENJOY THIS TYPE OF DANCING BUT THOSE FROM ABOUT 40 UPWARDS DO NOT LIKE THE NOISE OR FLASHING LIGHTS! SUPPERS ARE SERVED AND ALCOHOL MAY BE BROUGHT INTO THE HALL BUT NOT SOLD.{WHIST DRIVES(A CARD {GAME)}LIKE DANCES ARE HELD TO RAISE FUNDS FOR LOCAL GROUPS,W.R.I.,BOWLERS, LIDDESDALE HUNT. {
